translated: Basket of Conduct
The Chapter of Yudhañjaya
The Perfection of Truthfulness
The Story of the King of the Monkeys
“When I was a monkey,
on the bank of a river, in a ravine;
Oppressed by a python,
I could not get away.
Where I stood,
I jumped from this side to the other;
There was a killer, a hunter,

analyzed: kumbhīlaḥ ludda dassanaḥ  saḥ mama asasi ehi iti
translated: a crocodile with a voracious appetite.🔽He called out to me, ‘Come here!’
I said to him, ‘I’m coming!’
After I had gone to the end of it,
I stood on the other bank.
He did not lie,
as I did what I said;
In truthfulness there is no one equal to me,
this is my perfection of truthfulness.”
The Story of the King of the Monkeys, the seventh.
